intro: Hierochloe cuprea, commonly known as copper grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, often found in dry, open habitats such as rocky soils and sandy areas. The plant is characterized by its fine, reddish-brown leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in early summer. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in restoration projects due to its hardy nature. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat conservation.
